meanings.definition: Made resistant to damage or harm from exposure to weather.
meanings.sent1: The weatherproofed jacket kept me dry during the rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The weatherproofed roof prevented any leaks during the heavy downpour.
meanings.sent3: The weatherproofed tent laughed at the storm's attempts to soak it.
meanings.sent4: Her weatherproofed umbrella was a shield against the relentless rain.
meanings.sent5: The weatherproofed paint on the house shone brightly even after the storm passed.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to damage or harm from exposure to weather.
meanings.sent1: He weatherproofed his deck to protect it from the harsh sun and rain.
meanings.sent2: The builders weatherproofed the windows before the winter season.
meanings.sent3: She weatherproofed her garden gnome to ensure it could withstand any weather.
meanings.sent4: They weatherproofed the outdoor furniture, making it durable against the elements.
meanings.sent5: The sailors weatherproofed the sails before setting out on their voyage.
